text.div:
NCDHC Health Interaction Type

http://hl7.org.au/fhir/ch/v1/CodeSystem/ncdhc-hi-type-1

National Children's Digital Health Collaborative - Health Interactions which are recorded to capture the category of the event. In this instance the specific Health Interaction name will be derived.

name: ncdhc-hi-type
title: NCDHC Health Interaction Type
description: National Children's Digital Health Collaborative - Health Interactions which are recorded to capture the category of the event. In this instance the specific Health Interaction name will be derived.

concept.definition: A child is born, including details of the birth
A newborn child is discharged from care - discharge summary is generated
A newborn examination has been completed with an outcome recorded
Register Representative
Register Child
View Health Check Summary based on Jurisdiction

A child health assessment has been completed with an outcome recorded

concept.display: Family History and Risk Factors Consumer Entered
concept.definition: A family history has been entered by a consumer
An achievement or milestone is observed and recorded by a carer or parent
A child has presented in an emergency department
A clinical encounter has occurred and is recorded by a consumer, eg GP appointment, hospital appointment, hospital admission etc
A clinical encounter has occurred and was recorded by a clinical (jurisdictional), eg a hospital outpatient, hospital admission, etc
An observation (e.g. height, weight or head circumference) or measurement has been recorded
An observation (eg height, weight or head circumference) has been recorded
An appointment reminder based on a harmonised schedule (eg immunisations & health checks)
A clinician subscribes to a health interaction
A consumer consents to be part of the longitudinal child health record program
A consumer consents to be part of the longitudinal child health record program
A consumer consents to be part of the longitudinal child health record program
A clinician or consumer can view a list the health interactions they have subscribed to view
A clinician or consumer can view a child's longitudinal health record in context of the child's clinical record
A consumer can view a list of subscribers to their longitudinal record
A clinician or consumer can view a child's longitudinal health record in context of the child's clinical record
A consent record has been created and confirmed that the person is part of the pilot
A consumer can manage a list of subscribers to their longitudinal record including removal of subscribers
A newborn bloodspot screen has been completed with or without an outcome recorded
A newborn bloodspot screen assessment not conducted
A consumer can view an audit trail of consumers, providers and organisations who have accessed their child’s digital health record, including the data sets viewed
A consumer can add, manage and remove nominated representatives to view their child’s health record
